info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 8:42PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW BAND... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This band of heavy snow is producing heavy snow at the rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 840 PM MST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Grand Junction to near Palisade to 18 miles southeast of Fruita and moving east at 10 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Palisade around 910 PM MST. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 60. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 34 and 47. Colorado 65 between mile markers 56 and 61. Colorado 141 between mile markers 146 and 162. SAFETY INFO... Please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
